135 struct OutInfo

151 struct RunInfo
152 {
153  // the current testing id
154  chaos::str::UTF8String id;
155  // whether the tests should be run in a single process or not
156  bool single_proc;
157  // whether the test is being run as a sub-process of a parent testing
158  // process
159  bool sub_proc;
160  // the paths to the tests to run
161  std::set< chaos::str::UTF8String > paths;
162  // whether the standard output stream is being used
163  bool use_stdout;
164  // information for stdout
165  OutInfo stdout_info;
166  // mapping from file path to write to, to the format to use
167  std::map< chaos::str::UTF8String, OutInfo* > files;
168 
169  RunInfo()
170  :
171  single_proc( false ),
172  sub_proc ( false ),
173  use_stdout ( true ),
174  stdout_info( 3, TestLogger::OUT_PRETTY_TEXT )
175  {
176  }
177 };
178 
185 class TestCore
186 {
187 public:
188 
189  //-------------------------PUBLIC STATIC ATTRIBUTES-------------------------
190 
191  static TestLogger logger;
192  static std::map< chaos::str::UTF8String, UnitTest* > test_map;
193  static std::set< chaos::str::UTF8String > base_modules;
194  static std::set< chaos::str::UTF8String > known_modules;
195  static chaos::str::UTF8String current_module;
196 
197  //-------------------------------CONSTRUCTOR--------------------------------
198 
206  TestCore(
207  const chaos::str::UTF8String& path,
208  UnitTest* unit_test,
209  const chaos::str::UTF8String& file,
210  chaos::int32 line,
211  bool module = false,
212  RunInfo* run_info = NULL )
213  {
214  try
215  {
216  // run tests
217  if ( run_info )
218  {
219  TestCore::setup( run_info );
220  TestCore::run( run_info );
221  TestCore::teardown( run_info );
222  return;
223  }
224 
225  // module declaration
226  if ( module )
227  {
228  TestCore::declare_module( path, file, line );
229  return;
230  }
231 
232  // unit declaration
233  TestCore::declare_unit( path, unit_test, file, line );
234  }
235  // invalid pass errors are handled by main
236  catch ( const chaos::test::ex::InvalidPathError& e )
237  {
238  throw e;
239  }
240  catch ( chaos::test::ex::TestError& e )
241  {
242  // TODO: should this go to loggers?
243  std::cerr << e.get_message() << std::endl;
244  throw e;
245  }
246  }
247 
248 private:
249 
250  //-------------------------PRIVATE MEMBER FUNCTIONS-------------------------
251 
255  static void declare_module(
256  const chaos::str::UTF8String& path,
257  const chaos::str::UTF8String& file,
258  chaos::int32 line );
259 
263  static void declare_unit(
264  const chaos::str::UTF8String& path,
265  UnitTest* unit_test,
266  const chaos::str::UTF8String& file,
267  chaos::int32 line );
268 
272  static void setup( RunInfo* run_info );
273 
277  static void teardown( RunInfo* run_info );
278 
282  static void run( RunInfo* run_info );
283 
287  static void run_test(
288  UnitTest* unit_test,
289  const chaos::str::UTF8String& full_path,
290  RunInfo* run_info );
291 
295  static void run_current_proc(
296  UnitTest* unit_test,
297  const chaos::str::UTF8String& full_path,
298  RunInfo* run_info );
299 
303  static void run_current_proc_no_open(
304  UnitTest* unit_test,
305  RunInfo* run_info );
306 
310  static void run_new_proc(
311  UnitTest* unit_test,
312  const chaos::str::UTF8String& full_path,
313  RunInfo* run_info );
314 
318  static chaos::str::UTF8String generate_id(

384 #define CHAOS_TEST_MODULE( path ) \
385  namespace \
386  { \
387  chaos::test::internal::TestCore t( #path, NULL, "", 0, true ); \
388  }

395 #define CHAOS_TEST_UNIT( name ) \
396  CHAOS_TEST_UNIT_FIXTURE( name, chaos::test::Fixture )

426 #define CHAOS_TEST_UNIT_FIXTURE( name, fixture_type ) \
427  namespace \
428  { \
429  struct name : public chaos::test::internal::UnitTest \
430  { \
431  fixture_type* fixture; \
432  name() : UnitTest( #name ), fixture( new fixture_type() ){} \
433  virtual ~name(){ delete fixture; } \
434  virtual chaos::test::Fixture* get_fixture() { return fixture; } \
435  virtual void execute(); \
436  }; \
437  static chaos::test::internal::TestCore object_##name ( \
438  #name, new name(), __FILE__, __LINE__ ); \
439  } \
440  void name::execute()
441 
451 #define CHAOS_TEST_MESSAGE( message ) \
452  chaos::test::internal::TestCore::logger.write_message( message )
453 
460 #define CHAOS_CHECK_TRUE( a ) \
461  if ( ( a ) ) \
462  { \
463  chaos::test::internal::TestCore::logger.report_check_pass( \
464  "CHAOS_CHECK_TRUE", __FILE__, __LINE__ ); \
465  } \
466  else \
467  { \
468  chaos::test::internal::TestCore::logger.report_check_fail( \
469  "CHAOS_CHECK_TRUE", __FILE__, __LINE__, "" ); \
470  }
471 
478 #define CHAOS_CHECK_FALSE( a ) \
479  if ( !( a ) ) \
480  { \
481  chaos::test::internal::TestCore::logger.report_check_pass( \
482  "CHAOS_CHECK_FALSE", __FILE__, __LINE__ ); \
483  } \
484  else \
485  { \
486  chaos::test::internal::TestCore::logger.report_check_fail( \
487  "CHAOS_CHECK_FALSE", __FILE__, __LINE__, "" ); \
488  }
489 
495 #define CHAOS_CHECK_EQUAL( a, b ) \
496  { \
497  auto _a = ( a ); auto _b = ( b ); \
498  if ( _a == _b ) \
499  { \
500  chaos::test::internal::TestCore::logger.report_check_pass( \
501  "CHAOS_CHECK_EQUAL", __FILE__, __LINE__ ); \
502  } \
503  else \
504  { \
505  chaos::str::UTF8String f_e_m; \
506  f_e_m << _a << " does not equal " << _b; \
507  chaos::test::internal::TestCore::logger.report_check_fail( \
508  "CHAOS_CHECK_EQUAL", __FILE__, __LINE__, f_e_m ); \
509  } \
510  }
511 
518 #define CHAOS_CHECK_NOT_EQUAL( a, b ) \
519  { \
520  auto _a = ( a ); auto _b = ( b ); \
521  if ( _a != _b ) \
522  { \
523  chaos::test::internal::TestCore::logger.report_check_pass( \
524  "CHAOS_CHECK_NOT_EQUAL", __FILE__, __LINE__ ); \
525  } \
526  else \
527  { \
528  chaos::str::UTF8String f_e_m; \
529  f_e_m << _a << " equals " << _b; \
530  chaos::test::internal::TestCore::logger.report_check_fail( \
531  "CHAOS_CHECK_NOT_EQUAL", __FILE__, __LINE__, f_e_m ); \
532  } \
533  }
534 
535 } // namespace test
536 } // namespace chaos
537 
544 #define CHAOS_CHECK_THROW( statement, exception_type ) \
545  { \
546  bool caught = false; \
547  try \
548  { \
549  ( statement ); \
550  } \
551  catch( exception_type e ) \
552  { \
553  caught = true; \
554  chaos::test::internal::TestCore::logger.report_check_pass( \
555  "CHAOS_CHECK_THROW", __FILE__, __LINE__ ); \
556  } \
557  catch( ... ) {} \
558  if ( !caught ) \
559  { \
560  chaos::str::UTF8String f_e_m; \
561  f_e_m << "Exception type: " << #exception_type << " not thrown"; \
562  chaos::test::internal::TestCore::logger.report_check_fail( \
563  "CHAOS_CHECK_THROW", __FILE__, __LINE__, f_e_m ); \
564  } \
565  }
